TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit TrustManagerContext extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents the context for the trust manager to consider when making the decision to run an application, and when setting up the security on a new in which to run an application.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For a list of initial property values for an instance of the <xref:System.Security.Policy.TrustManagerContext> class, see the <xref:System.Security.Policy.TrustManagerContext.%23ctor> constructor.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public TrustManagerContext ();
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed
Public Sub New ()
public: TrustManagerContext();

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The following table shows the initial property values for a new instance of the <xref:System.Security.Policy.TrustManagerContext> class.
|Property|Initial value| |--------------|-------------------| |<xref:System.Security.Policy.TrustManagerContext.IgnorePersistedDecision%2A>|`false`| |<xref:System.Security.Policy.TrustManagerContext.KeepAlive%2A>|`false`| |<xref:System.Security.Policy.TrustManagerContext.NoPrompt%2A>|`false`| |<xref:System.Security.Policy.TrustManagerContext.Persist%2A>|`true`| |<xref:System.Security.Policy.TrustManagerContext.PreviousApplicationIdentity%2A>|`null`| |<xref:System.Security.Policy.TrustManagerContext.UIContext%2A>|<xref:System.Security.Policy.TrustManagerUIContext.Run>|

Docs.param: One of the values that specifies the type of trust manager user interface to use.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor initializes the properties to the same settings as the default constructor, with the exception of the <xref:System.Security.Policy.TrustManagerContext.UIContext%2A> property, which is set to the value that is passed in.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool IgnorePersistedDecision { get; set; }
.property instance bool IgnorePersistedDecision
Public Overridable Property IgnorePersistedDecision As Boolean
public: virtual property bool IgnorePersistedDecision { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.IgnorePersistedDecision : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the application security manager should ignore any persisted decisions and call the trust manager.
Docs.value: true to call the trust manager; otherwise, false.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If `true`, the <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationSecurityManager> ignores persisted decisions for the application and calls the trust manager. If `false`, the <xref:System.Security.Policy.ApplicationSecurityManager> uses cached decisions, if available.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool KeepAlive { get; set; }
.property instance bool KeepAlive
Public Overridable Property KeepAlive As Boolean
public: virtual property bool KeepAlive { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.KeepAlive : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the trust manager should cache state for this application, to facilitate future requests to determine application trust.
Docs.value: true to cache state data; otherwise, false. The default is false.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This flag is set to `true` if the host might call the trust manager numerous times for trust decisions for this application. If `true`, the trust manager should cache any state that might improve the speed of future calls to the <xref:System.Security.Policy.IApplicationTrustManager.DetermineApplicationTrust%2A> method. This property is set to `false` if the host does not expect to call the trust manager again for the current <xref:System.AppDomain>.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool NoPrompt { get; set; }
.property instance bool NoPrompt
Public Overridable Property NoPrompt As Boolean
public: virtual property bool NoPrompt { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.NoPrompt : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the trust manager should prompt the user for trust decisions.
Docs.value: true to not prompt the user; false to prompt the user. The default is false.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If `false`, the trust manager determines the appropriate user dialog to obtain a trust decision.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool Persist { get; set; }
.property instance bool Persist
Public Overridable Property Persist As Boolean
public: virtual property bool Persist { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.Persist : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user's response to the consent dialog should be persisted.
Docs.value: true to cache state data; otherwise, false. The default is true.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is `true` if the user’s response to the consent dialog should be persisted to avoid further prompting the user with each new activation request. This property is `false` if the user’s response should not be persisted.

public: virtual property System::Security::Policy::TrustManagerUIContext UIContext { System::Security::Policy::TrustManagerUIContext get(); void set(System::Security::Policy::TrustManagerUIContext value); };
member this.UIContext : System.Security.Policy.TrustManagerUIContext with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the type of user interface the trust manager should display.
Docs.value: One of the values. The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Security.Policy.TrustManagerContext.UIContext%2A> property is intended to recommend the user interface the trust manager should provide for the trust decision. A trust manager can decide to use a different interface.
